Some other examples \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} given under M\+A\+C\+RO in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} appendix. This facility \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} useful for fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a7ee4abe2dceee16ed21aa30d16352713}{statements}} and expressions. More complicated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a266df01acaa12f85ffe888494d501990}{M\+A\+T88}} \char`\"{}programs\char`\"{} should use \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a99c13c5700a5d8ef09125bad69607415}{E\+X\+EC}} facility. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a97607d1b57ca47c9c7fdb29a25fad589}{operations}} which access external \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} cannot be handled in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} completely machine-\/independent manner \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} portable \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} code. It \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} necessary for each particular installation to provide \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} subroutine which associates external text \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} logical unit numbers.\+6. C\+E\+N\+S\+US E\+X\+A\+M\+P\+LE Our first extended \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a8183c2bf8d1e67778b6cf80018c89d6b}{example}} involves predicting \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} United States in 1980 using extrapolation of various fits to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} census data from 1900 through 1970. There \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} eight observations, so we begin \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a266df01acaa12f85ffe888494d501990}{M\+A\+T88}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} = 8 The values of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} dependent variable, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population in millions, can be entered \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}} = $<$ 75.\+995 91.\+972 105.\+711 123.\+203 ... 131.\+669 150.\+697 179.\+323 203.\+212$>$\textquotesingle{} In order to produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably scaled \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} independent variable, time, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} transformed from \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interval \mbox{[}1900,1970\mbox{]} to \mbox{[}-\/1.\+00,0.\+75\mbox{]}. This can be accomplished directly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = -\/1.\+0\+:0.\+25\+:0.\+75 or in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fancier, but perhaps clearer, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a50bb17654285ab47c528bd15c11e15ce}{way}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1900\+:10\+:1970; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = (\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} -\/ 1940$\ast$ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}))/40 Either of these \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} equivalent to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = $<$-\/1 -\/.\+75 -\/.\+50 -\/.\+25 0 .\+25 .\+50 .\+75$>$ The interpolating polynomial of degree \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 involves an Vandermonde \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}} of order \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} elements that might be generated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$$\ast$(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); However, this \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac3184a4056593db0d92e28fe3684dc31}{results}} in an \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_ad2aaf1b57a93704deea8c793f8c0bc04}{error}} caused \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} 0$\ast$$\ast$0 when \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 5 and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1 . The preferable approach \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} = ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}); for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 2\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); Now \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a005a3056880026d7e5d31b3da074a132}{cond}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}) produces \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aed2591d2a093ce087083aeb946df7f2f}{A\+NS}} = 1.\+1819\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2a3e113e5b8e090e5c65a99e81e23c23}{E}}+03 which indicates that transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably well conditioned matrix. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{A\textbackslash{}y}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac3184a4056593db0d92e28fe3684dc31}{results}} in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a3a063ab18ff9fbeff794f149723fdd91}{C}} = 131.\+6690 41.\+0406 103.\+5396 262.\+4535 -\/326.\+0658 -\/662.\+0814 341.\+9022 533.\+6373 These \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interpolating polynomial \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} + ... + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} 1 2 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} Our transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1 corresponding to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} year 1980. Consequently, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} extrapolated population \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} simply \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} sum of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients. This can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) The result \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} P = 426.\+0950 which indicates \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} 1980 population of over 426 million. Clearly, using \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} seventh degree interpolating polynomial to extrapolate even \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} distance beyond \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_afb358f48b1646c750fb9da6c6585be2b}{end}} of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} data interval \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} not \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} good idea. The coefficients in least squares fits \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of lower degree can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} using fewer \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} columns of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} matrix. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}})\textbackslash{}\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) would produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients of these fits, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} well \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} resulting extrapolated population. If we do not want to \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_aeed89bed19dc9211a2f727e9985d455b}{print}} all \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients, we can simply generate \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} small table of populations predicted \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of degrees zero through seven. We \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ade3819bf3b3e0fd29e1b0074f4990c96}{also}} compute \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} maximum deviation between \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} fitted and observed values. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{X\textbackslash{}y}}; ... \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8}{d}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}-\/1; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac96b96742620adb301595bc5046518e8}{norm}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}}$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}-\/\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}},\textquotesingle{}inf\textquotesingle{}); For \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a8183c2bf8d1e67778b6cf80018c89d6b}{example}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae125978a34fea7849d19c630710ad8c2}{T}} = \textquotesingle{}2$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} + 3\textquotesingle{}; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a732e5473fee9bf5afa842843990cab00}{S}} = \textquotesingle{}\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ad3a46ad317f8826946f3c9a3ea39acc7}{B}} = $>$ \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae125978a34fea7849d19c630710ad8c2}{T}}$<$ + 5\textquotesingle{} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} = 4; $>$ \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a732e5473fee9bf5afa842843990cab00}{S}}$<$ produces \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ad3a46ad317f8826946f3c9a3ea39acc7}{B}} = 16. Some other examples \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} given under M\+A\+C\+RO in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} appendix. This facility \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} useful for fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a7ee4abe2dceee16ed21aa30d16352713}{statements}} and expressions. More complicated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a266df01acaa12f85ffe888494d501990}{M\+A\+T88}} \char`\"{}programs\char`\"{} should use \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a99c13c5700a5d8ef09125bad69607415}{E\+X\+EC}} facility. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a97607d1b57ca47c9c7fdb29a25fad589}{operations}} which access external \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} cannot be handled in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} completely machine-\/independent manner \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} portable \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} code. It \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} necessary for each particular installation to provide \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} subroutine which associates external text \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} logical unit numbers.\+6. C\+E\+N\+S\+US E\+X\+A\+M\+P\+LE Our first extended \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a8183c2bf8d1e67778b6cf80018c89d6b}{example}} involves predicting \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} United States in 1980 using extrapolation of various fits to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} census data from 1900 through 1970. There \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} eight observations, so we begin \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a266df01acaa12f85ffe888494d501990}{M\+A\+T88}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} = 8 The values of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} dependent variable, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population in millions, can be entered \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}} = $<$ 75.\+995 91.\+972 105.\+711 123.\+203 ... 131.\+669 150.\+697 179.\+323 203.\+212$>$\textquotesingle{} In order to produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably scaled \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} independent variable, time, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} transformed from \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interval \mbox{[}1900,1970\mbox{]} to \mbox{[}-\/1.\+00,0.\+75\mbox{]}. This can be accomplished directly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = -\/1.\+0\+:0.\+25\+:0.\+75 or in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fancier, but perhaps clearer, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a50bb17654285ab47c528bd15c11e15ce}{way}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1900\+:10\+:1970; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = (\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} -\/ 1940$\ast$ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}))/40 Either of these \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} equivalent to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = $<$-\/1 -\/.\+75 -\/.\+50 -\/.\+25 0 .\+25 .\+50 .\+75$>$ The interpolating polynomial of degree \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 involves an Vandermonde \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}} of order \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} elements that might be generated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$$\ast$(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); However, this \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac3184a4056593db0d92e28fe3684dc31}{results}} in an \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_ad2aaf1b57a93704deea8c793f8c0bc04}{error}} caused \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} 0$\ast$$\ast$0 when \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 5 and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1 . The preferable approach \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} = ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}); for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 2\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); Now \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a005a3056880026d7e5d31b3da074a132}{cond}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}) produces \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aed2591d2a093ce087083aeb946df7f2f}{A\+NS}} = 1.\+1819\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2a3e113e5b8e090e5c65a99e81e23c23}{E}}+03 which indicates that transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably well conditioned matrix. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{A\textbackslash{}y}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac3184a4056593db0d92e28fe3684dc31}{results}} in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a3a063ab18ff9fbeff794f149723fdd91}{C}} = 131.\+6690 41.\+0406 103.\+5396 262.\+4535 -\/326.\+0658 -\/662.\+0814 341.\+9022 533.\+6373 These \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interpolating polynomial \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} + ... + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} 1 2 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} Our transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1 corresponding to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} year 1980. Consequently, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} extrapolated population \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} simply \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} sum of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients. This can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) The result \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} P = 426.\+0950 which indicates \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} 1980 population of over 426 million. Clearly, using \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} seventh degree interpolating polynomial to extrapolate even \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} distance beyond \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_afb358f48b1646c750fb9da6c6585be2b}{end}} of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} data interval \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} not \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} good idea. The coefficients in least squares fits \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of lower degree can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} using fewer \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} columns of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} matrix. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}})\textbackslash{}\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) would produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients of these fits, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} well \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} resulting extrapolated population. If we do not want to \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_aeed89bed19dc9211a2f727e9985d455b}{print}} all \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients, we can simply generate \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} small table of populations predicted \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of degrees zero through seven. We \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ade3819bf3b3e0fd29e1b0074f4990c96}{also}} compute \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} maximum deviation between \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} fitted and observed values. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{X\textbackslash{}y}}; ... \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8}{d}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}-\/1; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac96b96742620adb301595bc5046518e8}{norm}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}}$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}-\/\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}},\textquotesingle{}inf\textquotesingle{}); $<$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8}{d}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}}$>$ The resulting output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} 0 132.\+7227 70.\+4892 1 211.\+5101 9.\+8079 2 227.\+7744 5.\+0354 3 241.\+9574 3.\+8941 4 234.\+2814 4.\+0643 5 189.\+7310 2.\+5066 6 118.\+3025 1.\+6741 7 426.\+0950 0.\+0000 The zeroth degree fit, 132.\+7 million, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} result of fitting \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} constant to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} data and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} simply \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} average. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac3184a4056593db0d92e28fe3684dc31}{results}} obtained \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} polynomials of degree one through four all appear reasonable. The maximum deviation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} degree four fit \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} slightly greater \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} degree three, even though \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} sum of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} squares of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} deviations \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} less. \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} or \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab997fb21bef012bb466f3fafefe8f35d}{then}} Some other examples \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} given under M\+A\+C\+RO in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} appendix. This facility \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} useful for fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a7ee4abe2dceee16ed21aa30d16352713}{statements}} and expressions. More complicated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a266df01acaa12f85ffe888494d501990}{M\+A\+T88}} \char`\"{}programs\char`\"{} should use \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a99c13c5700a5d8ef09125bad69607415}{E\+X\+EC}} facility. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a97607d1b57ca47c9c7fdb29a25fad589}{operations}} which access external \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} cannot be handled in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} completely machine-\/independent manner \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} portable \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} code. It \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} necessary for each particular installation to provide \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} subroutine which associates external text \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} logical unit numbers.\+6. C\+E\+N\+S\+US E\+X\+A\+M\+P\+LE Our first extended \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a8183c2bf8d1e67778b6cf80018c89d6b}{example}} involves predicting \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} United States in 1980 using extrapolation of various fits to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} census data from 1900 through 1970. There \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} eight observations, so we begin \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a266df01acaa12f85ffe888494d501990}{M\+A\+T88}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} = 8 The values of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} dependent variable, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population in millions, can be entered \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}} = $<$ 75.\+995 91.\+972 105.\+711 123.\+203 ... 131.\+669 150.\+697 179.\+323 203.\+212$>$\textquotesingle{} In order to produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably scaled \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} independent variable, time, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} transformed from \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interval \mbox{[}1900,1970\mbox{]} to \mbox{[}-\/1.\+00,0.\+75\mbox{]}. This can be accomplished directly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = -\/1.\+0\+:0.\+25\+:0.\+75 or in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fancier, but perhaps clearer, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a50bb17654285ab47c528bd15c11e15ce}{way}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1900\+:10\+:1970; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = (\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} -\/ 1940$\ast$ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}))/40 Either of these \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} equivalent to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = $<$-\/1 -\/.\+75 -\/.\+50 -\/.\+25 0 .\+25 .\+50 .\+75$>$ The interpolating polynomial of degree \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 involves an Vandermonde \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}} of order \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} elements that might be generated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$$\ast$(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); However, this \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac3184a4056593db0d92e28fe3684dc31}{results}} in an \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_ad2aaf1b57a93704deea8c793f8c0bc04}{error}} caused \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} 0$\ast$$\ast$0 when \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 5 and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1 . The preferable approach \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} = ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}); for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 2\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); Now \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a005a3056880026d7e5d31b3da074a132}{cond}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}) produces \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aed2591d2a093ce087083aeb946df7f2f}{A\+NS}} = 1.\+1819\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2a3e113e5b8e090e5c65a99e81e23c23}{E}}+03 which indicates that transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably well conditioned matrix. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{A\textbackslash{}y}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac3184a4056593db0d92e28fe3684dc31}{results}} in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a3a063ab18ff9fbeff794f149723fdd91}{C}} = 131.\+6690 41.\+0406 103.\+5396 262.\+4535 -\/326.\+0658 -\/662.\+0814 341.\+9022 533.\+6373 These \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interpolating polynomial \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} + ... + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} 1 2 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} Our transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1 corresponding to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} year 1980. Consequently, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} extrapolated population \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} simply \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} sum of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients. This can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) The result \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} P = 426.\+0950 which indicates \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} 1980 population of over 426 million. Clearly, using \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} seventh degree interpolating polynomial to extrapolate even \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} distance beyond \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_afb358f48b1646c750fb9da6c6585be2b}{end}} of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} data interval \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} not \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} good idea. The coefficients in least squares fits \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of lower degree can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} using fewer \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} columns of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} matrix. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}})\textbackslash{}\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) would produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients of these fits, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} well \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} resulting extrapolated population. If we do not want to \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_aeed89bed19dc9211a2f727e9985d455b}{print}} all \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients, we can simply generate \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} small table of populations predicted \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of degrees zero through seven. We \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ade3819bf3b3e0fd29e1b0074f4990c96}{also}} compute \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} maximum deviation between \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} fitted and observed values. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{X\textbackslash{}y}}; ... \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8}{d}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}-\/1; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac96b96742620adb301595bc5046518e8}{norm}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}}$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}-\/\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}},\textquotesingle{}inf\textquotesingle{}); Some other examples \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} given under M\+A\+C\+RO in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} appendix. This facility \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} useful for fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a7ee4abe2dceee16ed21aa30d16352713}{statements}} and expressions. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a97607d1b57ca47c9c7fdb29a25fad589}{operations}} which access external \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} cannot be handled in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} completely machine-\/independent manner \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} portable \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} code. It \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} necessary for each particular installation to provide \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} subroutine which associates external text \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_a7a953fc0014129dd416edec92ec0cf5f}{files}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a0a890a7b5e140ce2ce94502357b159cf}{Fortran}} logical unit numbers.\+6. C\+E\+N\+S\+US E\+X\+A\+M\+P\+LE Our first extended \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a8183c2bf8d1e67778b6cf80018c89d6b}{example}} involves predicting \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} United States in 1980 using extrapolation of various fits to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} census data from 1900 through 1970. There \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} eight observations, so we begin \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a266df01acaa12f85ffe888494d501990}{M\+A\+T88}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} = 8 The values of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} dependent variable, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} population in millions, can be entered \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}} = $<$ 75.\+995 91.\+972 105.\+711 123.\+203 ... 131.\+669 150.\+697 179.\+323 203.\+212$>$\textquotesingle{} In order to produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably scaled \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} independent variable, time, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} transformed from \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interval \mbox{[}1900,1970\mbox{]} to \mbox{[}-\/1.\+00,0.\+75\mbox{]}. This can be accomplished directly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = -\/1.\+0\+:0.\+25\+:0.\+75 or in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fancier, but perhaps clearer, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a50bb17654285ab47c528bd15c11e15ce}{way}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1900\+:10\+:1970; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = (\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} -\/ 1940$\ast$ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}))/40 Either of these \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} equivalent to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = $<$-\/1 -\/.\+75 -\/.\+50 -\/.\+25 0 .\+25 .\+50 .\+75$>$ The interpolating polynomial of degree \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 involves an Vandermonde \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}} of order \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} elements that might be generated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$$\ast$(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); However, this results in an \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_ad2aaf1b57a93704deea8c793f8c0bc04}{error}} caused \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} 0$\ast$$\ast$0 when \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 5 and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 1 . The preferable approach \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} = ones(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}); for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}} = 2\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}})$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}},\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa0b7cb0a04f82e3a2c0e877a33e0192f}{j}}-\/1); Now \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a005a3056880026d7e5d31b3da074a132}{cond}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}) produces \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aed2591d2a093ce087083aeb946df7f2f}{A\+NS}} = 1.\+1819\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2a3e113e5b8e090e5c65a99e81e23c23}{E}}+03 which indicates that transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonably well conditioned matrix. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{A\textbackslash{}y}} results in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a3a063ab18ff9fbeff794f149723fdd91}{C}} = 131.\+6690 41.\+0406 103.\+5396 262.\+4535 -\/326.\+0658 -\/662.\+0814 341.\+9022 533.\+6373 These \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interpolating polynomial \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}-\/1 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} + ... + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} 1 2 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} Our transformation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} time variable has resulted in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1 corresponding to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} year 1980. Consequently, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} extrapolated population \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} simply \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} sum of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients. This can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) The result \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} P = 426.\+0950 which indicates \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} 1980 population of over 426 million. Clearly, using \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} seventh degree interpolating polynomial to extrapolate even \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fairly \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2956ecc1a1b757f0d053aa446cd46890}{short}} distance beyond \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_afb358f48b1646c750fb9da6c6585be2b}{end}} of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} data interval \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} not \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} good idea. The coefficients in least squares fits \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of lower degree can be \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6d4e164739bb3d14a7e820f8236dcb0d}{computed}} using fewer \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}} columns of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} matrix. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}})\textbackslash{}\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) would produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients of these fits, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} well \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} resulting extrapolated population. If we do not want to \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_aeed89bed19dc9211a2f727e9985d455b}{print}} all \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficients, we can simply generate \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} small table of populations predicted \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} polynomials of degrees zero through seven. We \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ade3819bf3b3e0fd29e1b0074f4990c96}{also}} compute \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} maximum deviation between \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} fitted and observed values. for \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} = 1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6a54b1fb39b570ed947ba9bff09da1ee}{n}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{X\textbackslash{}y}}; ... \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8}{d}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}-\/1; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac96b96742620adb301595bc5046518e8}{norm}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}}$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}-\/\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}},\textquotesingle{}inf\textquotesingle{}); $<$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8}{d}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}}$>$ The resulting output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} 0 132.\+7227 70.\+4892 1 211.\+5101 9.\+8079 2 227.\+7744 5.\+0354 3 241.\+9574 3.\+8941 4 234.\+2814 4.\+0643 5 189.\+7310 2.\+5066 6 118.\+3025 1.\+6741 7 426.\+0950 0.\+0000 The zeroth degree fit, 132.\+7 million, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} result of fitting \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} constant to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} data and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} simply \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} average. The results obtained \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} polynomials of degree one through four all appear reasonable. The maximum deviation of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} degree four fit \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} slightly greater \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} degree three, even though \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} sum of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} squares of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} deviations \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} less. The coefficients of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} highest powers in \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} fits of degree five and six turn out to be negative and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} predicted populations of less \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} 200 million \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} probably unrealistic. The hopefully absurd prediction of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interpolating polynomial concludes \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} table. We wish to emphasize that roundoff errors \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} not significant here. Nearly identical results would be obtained on other computers, or \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} other algorithms. The results simply indicate \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} difficulties associated \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} extrapolation of polynomial fits of even modest degree. \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} stabilized fit \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} seventh degree polynomial can be obtained using \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} pseudoinverse, but \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ad6ef64fb9b12015a107b9ed4c99aac5b}{it}} requires \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} fairly delicate choice of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} tolerance. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab51cd29909e4fcfd3ade3a94fbee5d45}{statement}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a3691308f2a4c2f6983f2880d32e29c84}{s}} = svd(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}) produces \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} singular values \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a732e5473fee9bf5afa842843990cab00}{S}} = 3.\+4594 2.\+2121 1.\+0915 0.\+4879 0.\+1759 0.\+0617 0.\+0134 0.\+0029 We see that \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} last three singular values \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} less \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} 0.\+1 , consequently, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}} can be approximately \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}} of rank five \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} an \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_ad2aaf1b57a93704deea8c793f8c0bc04}{error}} less \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} 0.\+1 . The Moore-\/Penrose pseudoinverse of this rank five \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a87f6540bdacc78d66aa258ba9cb8419a}{matrix}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} obtained from \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} singular value decomposition \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a29faf1efa547eee7395013df5586bda5}{with}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} following \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a7ee4abe2dceee16ed21aa30d16352713}{statements}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = pinv(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}},0.\+1)$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}), \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac96b96742620adb301595bc5046518e8}{norm}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}}$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}-\/\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}},\textquotesingle{}inf\textquotesingle{}) The output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a3a063ab18ff9fbeff794f149723fdd91}{C}} = 134.\+7972 67.\+5055 23.\+5523 9.\+2834 3.\+0174 2.\+6503 -\/2.\+8808 3.\+2467 P = 241.\+1720 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2a3e113e5b8e090e5c65a99e81e23c23}{E}} = 3.\+9469 The resulting seventh degree polynomial has coefficients which \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} much smaller \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} those of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} interpolating polynomial given earlier. The predicted population and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} maximum deviation \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae2fdc33bcd49731e36913fa7258b0dc8}{are}} reasonable. Any choice of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} tolerance between \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} fifth and sixth singular values would produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} same results, but choices outside this range result in pseudoinverses of different rank and do not work \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac85e1322e210cd3e55055a318bee02d8}{as}} well. The one \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_ada23385ef8a89f31d1e7cc016012c2ff}{term}} exponential approximation \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}}) = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} exp(pt) can be transformed into \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} linear approximation \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a40eab2bd454e9f761f2d13dffa13fb19}{by}} taking logarithms. log(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}})) = log \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4626554aee0564362d52929f770837c4}{k}} + pt = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} + \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} 1 2 The following segment makes use of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a6c8a49d5d30f0f5f9583a3417de3a97e}{fact}} that \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a8eee149f4149309724d95d04c8c53b70}{function}} of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} vector \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a8eee149f4149309724d95d04c8c53b70}{function}} applied to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} individual components. \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:2); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = X\textbackslash{}log(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}}) \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a299fe281a9836080894d14b572094b33}{p}} = exp(sum(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}})) \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_aa6c8a54562a1cca01fd261c9af754463}{e}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ac96b96742620adb301595bc5046518e8}{norm}}(exp(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}}$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}})-\/\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{y}},\textquotesingle{}inf\textquotesingle{}) The resulting output \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a3a063ab18ff9fbeff794f149723fdd91}{C}} = 4.\+9083 0.\+5407 P = 232.\+5134 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2a3e113e5b8e090e5c65a99e81e23c23}{E}} = 4.\+9141 The predicted population and maximum deviation appear satisfactory and indicate that \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} exponential model \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} reasonable one to consider. As \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} curiousity, we return to \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} degree six polynomial. Since \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} coefficient of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} high order \mbox{\hyperlink{mold_8f90_ada23385ef8a89f31d1e7cc016012c2ff}{term}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} negative and \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} value of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a2857bbd4b5d07a07f178c59b854d9c80}{the}} polynomial at \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} = 1 \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} positive, \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ad6ef64fb9b12015a107b9ed4c99aac5b}{it}} must have \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19cefbe49a077540b7e33d4204e4b952}{a}} root at some value of \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a246e29540014c8569d5817c74e3ab425}{t}} greater \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a4602821dafb9f6eeb17c6c1a12f02d2c}{than}} one. The \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a7ee4abe2dceee16ed21aa30d16352713}{statements}} \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af536e6b6e19b0639461fca9bcd715b9c}{X}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a704581c21bacfe37f791e91c23af9393}{A}}(\+:,1\+:7); \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a5b7d43e28f3684aaff673e2a784fff8e}{X\textbackslash{}y}}; \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}} = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}(7\+:-\/1\+:1); z = \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a19a12944ce8e0fa189b3c1925e324518}{roots}}(\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ae362fa87fb711c5cd8c04d7d13e173c7}{c}}) produce \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_af864c3cbc46f83186db1258c56676f2e}{Z}} = 1.\+1023-\/ 0.\+0000$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} 0.\+3021+ 0.\+7293$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} -\/0.\+8790+ 0.\+6536$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} -\/1.\+2939-\/ 0.\+0000$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} -\/0.\+8790-\/ 0.\+6536$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} 0.\+3021-\/ 0.\+7293$\ast$\mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_a339c66297df8d20f247e4e17490bb48a}{i}} There \mbox{\hyperlink{test1_8txt_ab631344454190053f6ff38ac01e1dc15}{is}} only one real, positive root.
